alert.note: Alert for Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County; Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; South Central Elko County; Southwest Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 09 at 3:43PM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Moderate to heavy snow along I-80 in northern Nevada... Moderate to heavy snow at times will affect portions of northern Lander and Eureka counties eastward into Elko county through the late afternoon hours. These snow rates could bring rapidly deteriorating road conditions and significantly reduced visibility. Portions of I-80 east of Battle Mountain to Pequop Summit in addition to state routes 225 and 227 near Elko and US routes 93 from Wells to Lages Junction are expected to see impacts to travel from this snow event. In addition, much colder temperatures are on the way tonight which could make snow linger on untreated road surfaces longer. 1-2 inches of additional snow with localized amounts of 3 inches are possible through 700 pm. Snow intensity is expected to decrease this evening with a few light snow showers lingering through late this evening. Motorists should plan for near white out conditions, snow covered roads, and drifting snow in some locations. Travel is not recommended due to the intense rate of snowfall. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
